social-worker.title: Social worker
social-worker.lead: Coaching and reflective support work, grounded in phenomenology and attentive conversation. Seelsorge-style support where appropriate.
scopeNote: This is non-medical, non-psychotherapeutic support. Nothing here constitutes medical care, psychotherapy, or emergency services.
Please avoid sending highly sensitive personal data in the first message. If you need higher confidentiality, say so and we can agree on a safer channel.

items.name: Coaching (life & work contexts)
items.desc: Structured sessions to clarify decisions, reduce overwhelm, and build workable next steps. No diagnosis, no treatment claims.

items.name: Phenomenology-informed conversation
items.desc: Attention to lived experience: how situations show up, what is felt, what is avoided, and what is implicitly assumed.

items.name: Seelsorge-style support
items.desc: Calm, confidential conversation around meaning, guilt/shame themes, grief, and moral injury—without pressure or dogma.

items.name: Documentation & structure
items.desc: Help with templates, routines, boundary scripts, and workflow hygiene for support/care settings.

items.name: Workshops (small groups)
items.desc: Boundaries, communication under stress, reflective practice, and sustainable helping.

store.intro: Catalog only — no checkout on this site. Requests open an email draft.

current.desc: Short cycle: define problem → test interventions → consolidate outcomes.
Templates for saying no, holding limits, and de-escalating politely.
Facilitated session for teams or peer groups.

past.desc: Short series for navigating major transitions with language and boundary focus.
Pilot exploring calm routines in high-stress institutional environments.

timeline.title: Workshop format stabilized
timeline.desc: Repeatable small-group structure for reflective practice and boundary work.

timeline.title: Resource templates released
timeline.desc: Compact scripts and templates for practical boundary-setting.

timeline.title: Coaching approach refined
timeline.desc: Clearer goals, measurable steps, and follow-up routines.

consulting.title: Consulting
consulting.lead: Project management and operational support for agencies, teams, and small organizations — backoffice, marketing ops, and sales enablement.
scopeNote: This page describes operational consulting and delivery support. No legal advice, tax advice, or regulated financial advice.
If your request is sensitive (e.g., contracts, HR cases), keep the first message high-level and we’ll agree on an appropriate channel.

items.name: Project management (lightweight)
items.desc: Set goals, define scope, run cadence, manage risks, and keep delivery moving without bureaucracy.

items.name: Agency operations support
items.desc: Stabilize delivery systems: handoffs, briefs, QA checklists, client comms, and predictable throughput.

items.name: Backoffice setup
items.desc: Templates and routines for invoices coordination, document structure, asset organization, and reporting.

items.name: Marketing ops support
items.desc: Campaign planning, content pipeline hygiene, analytics basics (privacy-aware), and execution checklists.

items.name: Sales enablement
items.desc: Offer structure, pitch decks, proposal templates, discovery scripts, and CRM-friendly processes.

items.name: Process & tooling cleanup
items.desc: Reduce tool sprawl; define simple SOPs; align what people do with what’s tracked.

store.intro: Catalog only — no checkout on this site. Requests open an email draft.

current.desc: A practical bundle: project brief template, weekly status format, QA checklist, and handoff docs.
A short engagement to define scope, deliver a slice, and leave behind a working cadence.
Proposal structure + pricing table patterns + discovery questions + objection handling notes.

past.desc: Unified file structure, naming, and simple reporting rhythm to reduce operational drag.
Streamlined lead stages, improved handoffs, and reduced lost context in follow-ups.

timeline.title: Operations playbook shipped
timeline.desc: Delivered a lean set of templates and routines that made delivery status and ownership visible.

timeline.title: Agency workflow stabilization
timeline.desc: Reduced rework by standardizing briefs, QA gates, and client feedback loops.

timeline.title: Sales enablement refresh
timeline.desc: Improved proposal consistency and discovery quality with better scripts and structure.

engineer.title: Engineer
engineer.lead: Software engineering focused on Python, simulation & synthetic data, and database systems — pragmatic delivery with testability and reproducibility.
scopeNote: Engineering services are delivered with documentation, versioning, and reproducible environments where feasible.
Security and privacy constraints are respected; synthetic data is used where it meaningfully reduces risk.

items.name: Simulation pipelines
items.desc: Design and implementation of simulation workflows: scenario generation, parameter sweeps, reproducible runs, and reporting.

items.name: Synthetic data generation
items.desc: Configurable generators for structured test datasets; distributions, constraints, edge cases, and validation suites.

items.name: Data validation & QA
items.desc: Schema checks, invariants, data contracts, and CI-friendly validation to prevent silent regressions.

items.name: Database design & migrations
items.desc: Schema design, normalization/denormalization choices, migration plans, and safe rollout strategies.

items.name: Performance & reliability
items.desc: Indexing strategy, query tuning, caching patterns, and instrumentation to find bottlenecks early.

items.name: Data access layers
items.desc: Clean, testable data access with consistent error handling, transaction boundaries, and observability hooks.

items.name: Python tooling & automation
items.desc: CLIs, batch processing, internal tooling, and automation that’s maintainable and documented.

items.name: Packaging & environments
items.desc: Reproducible builds, dependency pinning, and deployment-friendly packaging patterns.

items.name: CI integration
items.desc: Tests, linters, formatting, and checks wired into CI so quality is enforced continuously.

store.intro: Catalog only — no checkout on this site. Requests open an email draft.

current.desc: Configurable generator for structured test datasets with constraints + validators.
Short engagement: query review, indexing plan, and a prioritized improvement checklist.
A small framework for schema checks + invariants with CI-friendly reports.

past.desc: Migration planning, refactors, and performance stabilization for a legacy schema.
Automated run orchestration + reporting artifacts for repeatable analysis.
Tooling for batch jobs, data import/export, and operational workflows.
Focused generator for pathological/rare cases to harden validation and QA.

timeline.title: Simulation pipeline delivered
timeline.desc: Reproducible workflow with testable outputs and automated reporting artifacts.

timeline.title: Database performance rescue
timeline.desc: Stabilized slow queries and reliability issues through indexing and migration strategy.

timeline.title: Tooling consolidation
timeline.desc: Reduced operational friction by standardizing Python tooling, environments, and CI checks.

scopeNote: Bestellungen erfolgen als Anfrage/Reservierung per E-Mail.

hipster.title: Hipster
hipster.lead: Games & Apps, Textiles, Open-Source-Hardware, Prototypen — und die Saftladen-Ecke, wo Ideen zu Dingen werden.
scopeNote: Das ist spielerische Produktionsarbeit: Prototypen, kleine Serien, Experimente. Verfügbarkeit variiert; manches ist made-to-order.
Kein Checkout auf der Seite: Bestellungen sind Abhol-Anfragen und werden manuell bestätigt.

items.name: Games & interaktive Prototypen
items.desc: Kleine Spiele, schräge UI-Ideen, schnelle Builds zum Testen eines Konzepts.

items.name: Apps & Tools
items.desc: Mini-Apps, die eine Sache gut lösen: Utilities, kleine Workflows, „Glue“-Software.

items.name: Textiles & kleine Serien
items.desc: Design + kleine Produktionsläufe: Patches, Prints, Shirts, Zines, Softgoods.

items.name: Open-Source-Hardware & Prototypen
items.desc: OSH-freundliche Builds: Proof-of-Concept, Gehäuse, dokumentations-first.

store.intro: Katalog — keine Zahlung auf dieser Website. Bestellungen öffnen eine E-Mail-Anfrage.

expert.title: Expert
expert.lead: Political analyses and interviews, justice-adjacent institutional knowledge, and information security auditing — method-first, evidence-forward.
scopeNote: Nothing here is legal advice. If you need legal counsel, consult a licensed attorney.
Analyses reflect methodological assessment and may be updated as new information becomes available.

items.name: Political analysis (briefs)
items.desc: Structured briefs: actors, incentives, constraints, scenario space, and uncertainty notes.

items.name: Interviews & synthesis
items.desc: Interview prep, question design, and synthesis that separates claims from evidence.

items.name: Methodology review
items.desc: Make reasoning legible: sources, assumptions, and what would falsify the conclusion.

items.name: Justice-adjacent process analysis
items.desc: Process mapping, role boundaries, and documentation around institutional workflows.

items.name: Information security & auditing
items.desc: Audit preparation, control mapping, evidence collection structure, and remediation planning.

items.name: Risk & compliance hygiene
items.desc: Practical risk registers, minimal viable documentation, and change-control discipline.

timeline.title: Audit evidence workflow
timeline.desc: Built a repeatable evidence collection structure with clear ownership and traceability.

timeline.title: Analysis format standardized
timeline.desc: Improved readability and falsifiability via structured briefs and uncertainty sections.

timeline.title: Interview & synthesis practice
timeline.desc: Refined process for question design and separating claims, context, and evidence.
